title: Steven Tyler sends Donald Trump cease-and-desist
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Marietta's Zach Seabaugh quit football team to sing, now on The Voice Marietta's Zach Seabaugh heads into the battle rounds on NBC's The Voice. WXIA Julie Wolfe, WXIA 6:27 a.m. EDT October 12, 2015 Zach Seabaugh brought his guitar to the Atlanta Alive set. (Photo: Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News) 25 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ATLANTA -- Four Atlanta artists will battle it out this week to stay on NBC's The Voice. Marietta's Zach Seabaugh will go into it armed with cowboy boots and his grandfather's dog tags. 
When asked about the moment all four judges turned their chairs for him, Seabaugh told 11Alive's Vinnie Politan and Chesley McNeil , "I don't really remember much of it. They weren't really turning around, and I was planning on going home." 
Within the last few seconds of his performance, those plans changed dramatically. Seabaugh wasn't lured by Adam Levine's flattery; he called him "Superman". He wasn't drawn in by Gwen Stefani comments about his good looks. Instead, he went with country music star Blake Shelton. "The reason I love country music is the story it tells," Seabaugh said. Marietta's Zach Seabaugh is on Blake Shelton's team on The Voice. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News The Atlanta Alive interview and performance with Zach Seabaugh will air on Monday, October 12th. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Zach wears his grandfather's dog tags since his grandpa is the one who introduced him to country music. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News We asked Zach if he always wears cowboy boots, or if it was part of his image. He said it's a little bit of both. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Vinnie and Chesley pose with Zach on the Atlanta Alive set. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News 11Alive's Jennifer Leslie captures photos of Zach in the 11Alive studio. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Zach's dad is his biggest fan! Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Zach's singing brought the 11Alive crew to a come watch. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Chesley's waiting for a chance to jump in with a duet. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Zach Seabaugh brought his guitar to the Atlanta Alive set. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Zach told Vinnie and Chesley if he didn't pick Blake, he would have gone to Adam. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Watch Marietta's Zach Seabaugh on Atlanta Alive Monday, October 12th. Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Zach Seabaugh with Chesley McNeil Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News On the 11Alive Midtown set Julie Wolfe, 11Alive News Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide 
Seabaugh credits his grandfather with introducing him to country music. It's why he wears his grandfather's dog tags from the Korean War around his neck. Seabaugh said it's his way of giving the man credit. 
The 16-year-old said he was drawn in to drama and music, but didn't embrace it at first because he worried he wouldn't fit in. "It wasn't the coolest thing," he said. 'The Voice' returns to 11Alive 
But, eventually, he embraced his talent. He told his parents he was quitting the football team to focus on his music. His supportive dad was with him when he visited the set of Atlanta Alive before the battle rounds began. 
Seabaugh said he's trying to make the most of the opportunity. He's back at school until the live shows resumes. "I'm back at school, trying to live a normal 16-year-old life," he said. "The pressure builds, definitely, leading up to it." 
You can watch The Voice Monday night on 11Alive at 8:00 p.m. Gauthier, Robert –– – 092682.CA.0213.grammy.RCG –– Singers Gwen Stefani, left, and Eve perform at the 47th annual Grammy Awards at the Staples Center in Los Angeles, Sunday, February 13, 2005. –– PHOTO CREDIT: Robert Gauthier/Los Angeles Times Robert Gauthier WASHINGTON, DC - DECEMBER 4: (AFP OUT) Gwen Stefani arrives for the formal artist's dinner for the Kennedy Center Honors at the United States Department of State December 4, 2010 in Washington, D.C.
